questions.question: What is the primary focus of craniosacral therapy?
questions.answer: The craniosacral system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the craniosacral system?
questions.answer: Lungs

questions.question: What is the typical rate of the craniosacral rhythm?
questions.answer: 6-12 cycles per minute

questions.question: Who is credited with developing craniosacral therapy in the 1970s?
questions.answer: John Upledger

questions.question: What is the primary function of cerebrospinal fluid?
choices: To provide nutrients and act as a shock absorber
To filter toxins from the blood
questions.answer: To provide nutrients and act as a shock absorber

questions.question: Which layer of the meninges is the outermost?
questions.answer: Dura mater

questions.question: How much pressure is typically used in craniosacral therapy?
choices: About the weight of a nickel
As much as possible to manipulate bones
Varies greatly depending on the condition
questions.answer: About the weight of a nickel

questions.question: What is the primary goal of craniosacral therapy?
choices: To release restrictions in the craniosacral system
questions.answer: To release restrictions in the craniosacral system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a cranial bone?
questions.answer: Femur

questions.question: What is the significance of the craniosacral rhythm in assessment?
choices: It indicates overall health of the craniosacral system
questions.answer: It indicates overall health of the craniosacral system

questions.question: Which of the following is a core principle of craniosacral therapy?
choices: The body has no self-corrective mechanisms
The craniosacral system is isolated from other body systems
Forceful manipulation is necessary for healing
The body has inherent self-corrective mechanisms
questions.answer: The body has inherent self-corrective mechanisms

questions.question: How many bones make up the cranium?
What is the role of the practitioner in craniosacral therapy?
choices: To facilitate the body's natural healing processes
questions.answer: To facilitate the body's natural healing processes

questions.question: Which structure connects the cranium to the sacrum?
questions.answer: Dura mater

questions.question: What is the craniosacral system described as in terms of its structure?
questions.answer: A semi-closed hydraulic system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical listening station for assessing craniosacral rhythm?
questions.answer: Elbows

questions.question: What is the primary focus of the palpation exercises in craniosacral therapy?
questions.answer: To feel the craniosacral rhythm

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the craniosacral rhythm?
questions.answer: A subtle expansion and contraction

questions.question: What is the relationship between craniosacral therapy and osteopathy?
choices: Craniosacral therapy has its roots in osteopathy
Osteopathy is a branch of craniosacral therapy
They are different names for the same practice
questions.answer: Craniosacral therapy has its roots in osteopathy

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a claimed benefit of craniosacral therapy?
choices: Improved function of the central nervous system
questions.answer: Increased muscle mass

questions.question: What is the current state of scientific evidence supporting craniosacral therapy?
questions.answer: Limited, with further research needed

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the approach of craniosacral therapy?
questions.answer: Gentle and non-invasive

questions.question: What is the significance of the sacrum in craniosacral therapy?
choices: It is not relevant to the therapy
It is a key component of the craniosacral system
It is only important in pediatric cases
It is the primary focus of all treatments
questions.answer: It is a key component of the craniosacral system

questions.question: Which of the following professionals might practice craniosacral therapy?
choices: A variety of healthcare professionals including massage therapists and physical therapists
questions.answer: A variety of healthcare professionals including massage therapists and physical therapists

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the group discussion on traditional Timorese healing practices?
choices: To replace traditional practices with craniosacral therapy
To understand local context and integrate new knowledge
To evaluate the effectiveness of traditional practices
questions.answer: To understand local context and integrate new knowledge

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the philosophy of craniosacral therapy?
choices: A reductionist approach focusing on individual symptoms
A holistic approach emphasizing the interconnectedness of body systems
A pharmaceutical approach to managing pain
A surgical approach to correcting physical abnormalities
questions.answer: A holistic approach emphasizing the interconnectedness of body systems

questions.question: What is the primary challenge in introducing craniosacral therapy in Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of interest from the population
Cultural sensitivity and integration with traditional practices
questions.answer: Cultural sensitivity and integration with traditional practices

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration in adapting craniosacral therapy for Timor-Leste?
choices: Respecting local customs regarding touch and personal space
Implementing the therapy exactly as practiced in Western countries
questions.answer: Respecting local customs regarding touch and personal space

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating educational materials for local communities?
choices: To promote understanding and acceptance of craniosacral therapy
To discourage the use of local healthcare systems
To recruit students for international craniosacral therapy programs
questions.answer: To promote understanding and acceptance of craniosacral therapy

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a suggested adaptation for teaching craniosacral therapy in Timor-Leste?
choices: Ignoring cultural beliefs about health and healing
Adapting techniques for limited resource settings
questions.answer: Ignoring cultural beliefs about health and healing
